article.headline: Boston U. 78, Hartford 45
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Chaz Carr had five 3-pointers and finished with a season-high 23 points on Saturday to lead Boston University to a 78-45 win over Hartford. Carr hit a 3-pointer to start an 18-1 second-half run that gave the Terriers a 64-33 lead with 8:29 to play. Carr also ended the run when he grabbed a defensive rebound, drove down court and hit a pullup jumper on the break. Rashad Bell scored 15 points and had a game-high seven rebounds for BU (17-4, 11-1 America East), which outrebounded Hartford, 36-26. The Terriers, who came into the game leading America East in scoring defense, forced 18 turnovers and held the Hawks' two leading scorers, Aaron Cook and Ryan Stys, to 11 points each. BU used a pair of 11-0 runs in the first half to take a 39-20 halftime lead. After BU scored five consecutive points to start the second half, Hartford (9-11, 4-7) went on a 12-2 run to close the gap to 46-32 when Stys converted a turnover into a easy layup. But Carr followed with his 3-pointer to start to decisive run.
